speaker: 11_DORI
text: Sam has been, has taken such an interest in this retirement bit. That it... it really surprises me.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Uh, she used to go over and read a book.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: B- turn a deaf ear. That was for sure...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: But uh, once you understand it, you know you...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: You're interested in getting right in, and going after it.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Yeah. I really oughta call, at least Reg Barr, and ask if uh, he's still speaking to me.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Well now he was the one that was up on the uh left.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Well he came over to you all smiles, I noticed.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: N yes. Well, we've known each other for thirty some years, why wouldn't he. But a- anyway, um, I was so glad that he opened up on this disclosure bit... because it was Burns that's been ob jecting to our having it.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: And I knew this. So when he opened up on that, and she followed through, and told about her husband, you know...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Not necessarily that she would approve of it, but at least she wasn't disapproving.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: And uh, course Duvall might-... uh And I-. I cannot get over this. That man. I really cannot. And you know, he must have been thinking, when he said he wasn't a political appointee, he must have been associating his relationship with Steitler...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: In his thinking. I don't know how else he could have done it. That topples over...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: He said I loved your uh hum- humor, uh, and I love you, but, I am not a political appointee. And his eyes were just snapping...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: How did you get on the board...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Well he said, I got a letter from the governor asking...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Everybody on there is an app- political appointee...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: The point was, I could have mentioned what was in the paper about him, that he was related, uh you know, had business with Steitler, And I just said, and there's Doctor Duvall, you know...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: And then I went to Rotus, who's a seasoned politician.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: If there ever was one, he just would flare. And I said, well I-. Alright. I said, I'll apologize next time... uh And I'm gonna make hay out of it. Don't you worry...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I wanna know how you birds got on that board, if you're not political appointees...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Can I grow some basil. From seed.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Yes, that's how I've-. I don't have any this year, but I've grown it other years.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: There's no problem. It will not take any frost. Soon as the b-...

speaker: 11_SAM
text: A little bit of frost, it's gone.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I l-. I learned that... one time the-.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: I learned it just went down.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: The hard way. Hm. Uh huh.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Well I think it was Barbara that has some seeds.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Just-. No problem. It comes right up.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Isn't that what you gave the neighbor one time.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You gave him some kind of herb.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Did I give him some. I gave him a red pepper.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I think you-. I think you gave him some herb of some kind.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: I may have given- given him some basil, yes.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: I don't have any this year, I forgot to plant it, I have oregano.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: A good stand of it, if you want any.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Yeah. I have a lot of dried or- oregano...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You smoked it down into the cork, didn't you.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You smoked it down into the cork.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Well, yeah, you don't like that...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: No, It chokes me to death.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: It's there, might as well smoke it.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: He's uh keeping very busy, he's on mostly uh evening hours.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: They're redoing the pharmacy there at Wel- Wallmart.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: It's close to the garden shop, and so the fellows in the garden shop, and the pet shop, have to move things out from that area.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Into the garden shop, so they can work on the pharmacy.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Well they needed to expand the pharmacy, I've never been there, but, what I had to wait and wait and wait.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Where are they putting the pharmacy.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Well they're b- leaving it in the same place, they're just taking out two rows of, of uh.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Yeah. Just inventory stuff. Moving it.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Uh uh They're... they're moving that. I don't know where, where they're going to put all that.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: But Ted says there's not much garden left...

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Just, all of this stuff, out in there, he works uh six days next week, instead of five days...

speaker: 11_SAM
text: He only gets one day off.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: But he hasn't had day hours, he's been working evening hours and weekends.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: You know, I think I'd hate to be in business right now.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: You have to expand, or something...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: To keep in the main stream.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Well, and so many times when they expand, they've expanded, and then things dropped back.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: But this Wallmart needs, uh needs a larger building.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Your shirt and beads are most becoming.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Well you know, I think they weigh about a quarter of an ounce. And that's the right kind of beads.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: A little girl the other day, remarked about them, and, almost on impulse, but I didn't do it. I thought I'd pull em off, just give em to her if she liked em that well...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: You know. But then I thought, these are the only summer beads I have.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Right. And I like. I like that b- shirt.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: You know what I had to do. This.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: This. See where I sewed right down the middle of that.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Otherwise it would balloon out. And so I s-, put it on the machine, and sewed right down through the middle of it...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: So it d- doesn't gap-. Right.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: It had a, it had a, one of those bottoms that.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Are... what do you call it.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: No. The tight. It- uh uh the band.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: The t- the tight band around the bottom of it.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Most all of em are that way.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I went over to a store, where it says...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Uh sewing, alterations. And all that stuff. And I said, how much do you charge, for taking that bottom band off the top, you know. And just making it a straight shirt. And she said, eight dollars. And I thought, oh my lord, I didn't pay that much for the top I've got on...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You know, that's a little like these catalog things. I saw something in a cat-... the catalog, this USPE deal that-, I've been with for a long time, and, I wanted to buy it, It was a m-, m- like a muumuu.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Weren't those pretty ones up, in Dillards the other day, those muumuus, did you notice em. Didn't you notice em, as you went out, all beautiful colors. So pretty. Well anyway, they were on the rack. And uh, I wanted to order that muumuu, I mean it was around twenty-nine dollars, or something like that, and two pairs of short pajamas. One for Sam, and one for me. And, I looked at the postage attached to it...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: And I thought good heavens. It would have been around eight dollar-. It's by amounts of money. Not weight. It's by money. How much money this costs. And it's geared according to that. And I thought, uh forget it. I could take that eight dollars, and buy another whole outfit.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Yeah, you know, this is amazing. Uh, I like to get um pillow covers. That you zip on, to protect the pillows.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And uh, I went over to Sears, one time, and ordered three. Through the catalog. And instead of sending it in with a shipment or anything...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I paid postage on it separate.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And do you know the postage came to more.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Than the g-... than the product.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Well I. I w-... uh That's one of the letters that I'm going to write to USPE. And just tell them...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: That they're gearing this in the wrong way. It should be geared according to weight. Now. That g- cotton... two pairs of cotton pajamas, and that cotton muumuu, ain't gonna weigh up to eight dollars worth, Believe you me.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I know better. So, I thought th-, I just won't order from em. I m-. That's foolish.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: We better go up to Dillards, and see if they still have those muumuus.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: No, well- they might have them here, in town.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: They... they were sure pretty. Pretty c-... pretty colors. Some of em were dark.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: But they had, oh, purples and, uh reds and, pinks and, oh, pretty designs in em.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I don't think I was-. I was. I think I was concerned about your getting there and back...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You're not the only one baby...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Sam, I was just dripping. I was just soaked.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I was just absolutely soaked. Wasn't I.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Yeah. She c- came in, and sat down in the restaurant...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: You know and spent, the first ten or fifteen minutes.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: stopping the flow of... trickling down her neck...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I. My other Doris does the same thing.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I don't know. She doesn't know.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Well I didn't persp- use to perspire like that.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: But I sure have done it.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: No, not to that extent you didn't.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Recently... uh Th- that, and the time we were up in uh, M- Montgomery Wards. Remember.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: And that was in the winter.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Well maybe that's what this was. But anyway.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I wish the stores would open earlier.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Instead of ten o'clock, in the summertime they oughta open at least at nine...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Uh it would help. Eight o'clock would be fine.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: You hate to start out at ten o'clock.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I'd say eight, and quit at four...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: You know the little folks who live above me.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Go over to Tucson Mall, and walk every morning...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Unlocked. So that they can go in, oh I think.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: They go r- uh- at least by eight o'clock...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And then they know <XX>, so many times around, you know.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Will um, make a mile. And then there's a, soft drink place up there that they all congregate.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And they have pins, when they cover fifty miles, or whatever you know.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: What outfit is this from. Oasis.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: It's just a neighborhood thing. It's just people around in that area.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: And they go there to walk...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I think. I think that's it. But uh, I-... uh... we've been over there, and we've seen em go in, and all they're doing is just walking.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Mhm. They might be good people, we could cultivate to hunt things for us...

speaker: 11_SAM
text: You mean look in the window.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Instead of having to parade all around looking for it...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: They're around, why not tell us where that is.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Well yeah, well they can explain...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Make it pay off... Be glad to shop for you...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I still haven't found anybody that wants to, let me pay a little fee, and then, call em every morning, that I'm up and around.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: What what what w-. Back up a minute. Do what.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I've been looking for somebody, who will sit by the phone in the morning, and a-... and clients will call in and say, good morning, I'm up... And so th-... they're through for the day then. I'm up. If I don't call in by say nine o'clock. Then.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Well I'll be glad to do that for a fee.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: How much is the fee though...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: It-... does that b-... does it really bother you.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I'd like to have somebody I could call in to, every morning...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You call in, or I call in.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I call in and let you-... whoever it is, know I'm up.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: You can do that with us. We're up.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You can do it with <XX>-... uhuh you can do that with us, sometimes we're up at four o'clock...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Well, I would like to have it on a business basis with somebody.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Well, well alright. We'll put it on a business basis.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Yeah. It's on a business basis right now.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I'll. I'll draw up the papers.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You do that. We'll have them witnessed, and...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Should we have an attorney to advise us.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Oh, I think I can do that...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: What else were you cooking in there.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Just the bread pudding. I made uh, bean salad for us for lunch.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Listen. I've found out, that uh I can enhance, uh various dishes that I cook, if I use my onion powder and garlic powder. Not the onion salt, but the... the onion powder.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And I've... uh Other day, somebody was eating lunch at my house...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And I put some onion powder in the mayonnaise, and put it on some boiled eggs. Opened em up, and I didn't stuff the eggs. I just put that mayonnaise on top. And they said, oh that's good. How did you do that.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: I don't have any onion powder.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And it's not very expensive either.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: You can find it in Wallgreens, in great big bunches of stuff. There about. Yeah I.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Well, I got the word the other day, that I gotta cut salt. Oh you've been telling me that all along, and I've been trying to do it, I b- thought I'd b- b- was doing pretty well. But he. I don't think the man knows uh what he's about. I mean you know.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: A- aren't you going to see him soon. Again.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: She saw him Monday, and, and then in two months...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I had a a, an <XX>-ray, what...

speaker: 11_SAM
text: They haven't called you on the blood.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: We should get a, a paper today. They were gonna send a copy.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Uh, that. Excuse me, I've got the hiccups... He said uh, take uhuh the uh...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: What do you call it. The water pill. Diarrhetic. Take one of the capsules, and two of the white. Las- Lazex. Or something like.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Lazix... but I'll be taking the generic drug. Of it. In the morning. Then in the afternoon, take the capsule and one one Lazik.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I can't do it. My stomach gives me trouble, I cramp.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Are are you uh eating Tums, for calcium.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: I have-. Oh I did take, I did s-... call out last night, and say l-, uh make a note for potassium though.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Do you have one of those little things that has a compartment in it for each day.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: No. Heaven sakes... I'm not a very good pill taker, I'm re-. I think I'm resenting.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I'm not either, but I have.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: And I think it's contributing to my problems. I really do. I think that the cardazam is, I think that the d- diarrhetic is, uh.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Well now your, your ankles were down this morning and your legs.

speaker: 11_DORI
text: Well yes. They are. They were. Now look at em.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: That the spring broke in my recliner...

speaker: 11_DORI
text: You've told us that. And Dorsen's fixed it.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And... and two men came in, and wrestled it all over the floor...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And they found out, that, it was easier, they went back out the truck, and got a g-... a whole assembly, for one side. The- the- the-.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Was this on the seat or the back.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Makes the feet go out. The the the f-... the footrest goes out. You know there's a... uh a a mechanism there.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: So they put a whole new mechanism in on side.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And I wasn't prepared for them to...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I was going to tip them, but I wasn't prepared. To b- buy the chair. Over again...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: I gave em ten dollars, but that's all I had.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: They're on salary with the c-... with the company anyway.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: But they were so jovial, and.

speaker: 11_SAM
text: Was that spring from your seat or the back of th- your chair.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Nice. Now, it was a, a tight little spring, that um...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: Governed the mechanism. And held the chair together, when you put out.

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: The foot rest. And I told. Well I think I told you this. I phoned her and said, I don't know whether I can sit in the chair at all or not. And I said, and besides, when I go by it, it snarls at me...

speaker: 11_ANGE
text: And, and she... sh- she said, well it's alright to sit on it, but don't put the footrest out... NA
